instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PCH heating up
threads.message: Board came in with very little water damage near <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground from the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> being shorted, I replaced the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, short is gone but board tries to start with USB power but no USB activity and no VCORE, while inspecting with thermal camera PCH gets a little hot around 40c and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> also gets a little hot at around 36c, board gets 20v at 0.25a and stays there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PCH heating up
threads.message: You should check power on sequence; classic signals and voltages.
